      Methods in org.stormdev.mc.bossbarapi.api that return types with arguments of type CustomBossBar 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Map<java.util.UUID,CustomBossBar> BossBarAPI.addGlobalBarToOnline(java.lang.String message, float percent)
      Set a message for all players.
      It will remain there for each player until the player logs off or another plugin overrides it.
      This method will show a health bar using the given percentage value and will cancel any running timers.
      java.util.List<CustomBossBar> BossBarAPI.getBars(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)

      void BossBarAPI.setHealth(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, CustomBossBar bar, float percent)
      Modifies the health of an existing bar.
      If the player has no bar, this method does nothing.
      void BossBarAPI.setMessage(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, CustomBossBar bar, java.lang.String message)
      Set a message for the given player.
      It will remain there until the player logs off or another plugin overrides it.
      This method will show a full health bar and will cancel any running timers.
      void BossBarAPI.setMessage(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, CustomBossBar cbb, java.lang.String message, float percent)
      Set a message for the given player.
      It will remain there until the player logs off or another plugin overrides it.
      This method will show a health bar using the given percentage value and will cancel any running timers.
      void BossBarAPI.setMessage(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, CustomBossBar cbb, java.lang.String message, int seconds)
      Set a message for the given player.
      It will remain there until the player logs off or another plugin overrides it.
      This method will use the health bar as a decreasing timer, all previously started timers will be cancelled.
      The timer starts with a full bar.
      The health bar will be removed automatically if it hits zero.
